result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laurie A Blount

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laurie A Blount not in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Laurie A Blount.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing. Defense states that defendant's son passed away and is requesting an adjournment. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Laurie A Blount in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Laurie A Blount.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjournment. State does not appose. Court grants the defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Motion to Adjourn
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Case set for return on warrant. Bail hearing proceed. Court reinstates bail of $1500.00 Signature Bond.   Court adjourned case, Branch 38. **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Laurie A Blount in court with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz. Patrick O'Keefe on behalf of Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Return on Warrant. Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.

Defendant Laurie A Blount in court, via zoom, with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel needs file from prior counsel request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

01:40 PM Defendant Laurie A Blount in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Laurie A Blount in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Laurie A Blount in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Laurie A Blount appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
